title: 1.047 CONDEMNATION PROCEEDINGS IN STATE COURTS BY UNITED STATES.
text: When consent to the acquisition by the United States of any land or any right or interest in land by condemnation is given by sections 1.041 to 1.048, the United States may effect condemnation in the courts of this state in accordance with the laws of this state relating to eminent domain, or may effect condemnation in the courts of the United States as authorized by act of Congress. When consent by the Land Exchange Commission is required by section 1.041 the commission may specify which method of condemnation shall be used as a condition of its consent.

variables.name: consent_given_by_sections_1.041_to_1.048
variables.description: Indicates if consent is given by sections 1.041 to 1.048 for land acquisition by the United States.

variables.name: consent_required_by_land_exchange_commission
variables.description: Indicates if consent by the Land Exchange Commission is required.

variables.name: court
variables.description: The court where the condemnation is to be effected, either 'state' or 'federal'.

variables.name: method_specified_by_commission
variables.description: Indicates if the Land Exchange Commission has specified the method of condemnation.

consequences: The United States may effect condemnation in the state or federal courts.
The Land Exchange Commission specifies the method of condemnation as a condition of its consent.
